cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 200 miles SSE of Port Arthur, Texas and Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coast, then turning north across Louisiana and Arkansas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX/LA border, roughly between Port Arthur, TX and Cameron, LA

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from the Mouth of the Mississippi River to Ocean Springs, MS including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Lake Borgne
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from San Luis Pass, TX to Intracoastal City, LA; Storm Surge Warning from Freeport, TX to the Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-west Gulf Coast from Freeport, TX eastward across coastal Louisiana to the Mississippi River mouth
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (80%) of 34-kt (tropical-storm) winds with a 23% chance of 50-kt gusts; hurricane-force winds are unlikely but possible in squalls
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible in Galveston Bay, including Texas City docks
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches of rainfall possible with localized totals to 15 inches, producing flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents, large waves, and a slight tornado risk in outer rain bands
